data.what_is: Ontraport is a no-code business software that empowers service businesses to systemize and scale. Ontraport manages and automates the entire buying cycle, resulting in faster growth while freeing up business owners and teams to deliver more customer value. Ontraport's full set of marketing, sales and business operations features include CRM, automation, payments, sales pipeline, web apps, tracking, email and SMS, landing pages, and membership sites. Service providers of all kinds -- including consultants and agencies, coaches and advisors, and personal and professional service providers -- trust Ontraport to achieve more growth with less work. For more information, visit www.ontraport.com.
data.product_description: Ontraport is an all-in-one integrated platform that delivers essential business features, including a powerful CRM system, membership sites, one-click WordPress hosting, outstanding email delivery, payment processing, direct-mail printing, affiliate management, and our innovative business automation suite.

initial_reviews.review_title: How often do you love a company MORE the longer you stay with them?
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
edited to add: i am fangirling their whole damn support team. they are dreamy.

Ontraport impresses me for two reasons.

First, OP is the first platform that has me believing that an all-in-one platform is a good choice. Over the past year I've looked at a number of CRMs, LMSs, and ESPs, and I didn't like any all-in-one options so I was prepared to stitch together different platforms to get the experience I'm after. But as I've explored OP during the trial period I can see its power for my future business - the business I'm building toward over the next year. I can totally see how putting these systems in place while the business is still smal will be very smart over the longer haul. I can see the way it will save me time. I can see the way I can more easily bring team-members on. It's very exciting.

Second, their customer service is TO DIE FOR. My first call didn't go super well and I shared that feedback -- in the post-support survey and also with the person who recommended OP to me. Next thing I knew the SWAT team had swooped in, and everybody was on deck to make sure I was taken care of. I get extra TLC from a VP, a long call with an account exec, and very attentive support in the chat. They understood my questions, kept me focused on the most crucial things I needed to know to launch my membership, and helped me see what was possible and how to do it with my very short deadline.

The people truly are extraordinary, and are 100% the reason I'm signing on as a new client.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
The price -- with a caveat.

I've been exploring membership sites and that's my primary use for OP right now. Given that, I wish it had a better entry price point, since I'm not looking for an all-in-one CRM/ESP/payment platform/course platform etc.

That said, for its full power, I think OP is well-priced. And much to my surprise, the trial period has me thinking about how well OP will serve my future business. So I'm willing to pay more now with the hope that it's the right move longer-term. But it *is* more than I would pay if I were just choosing a membership platform.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
I came to Ontraport to explore a membership platform. I really want a platform that has a community chat feature, which they don't all have. I also wanted a user-friendly design for my members. Other platforms I've looked at have had one but not both. Ontraport has them both. Add to that the simplicity of payment processing and integrations and I'm very happy with OP as a solution.

Even more, it is simple to set up email automations and reminders within the membership, and now that I can do that I can imagine using it as my ESP and my CRM moving forward. So they're solving a problem I wasn't looking to solve because I had another solution...but OP's solution looks better.

Ontraport is a highly flexible CRM and sales platform and the ease of implementation by way of the support teams onboarding skills was a massive part of my decision to choose this. I host a variety of online courses on Ontraport and also have an automated sales funnel at the front end of this.  It captures leads from my website (ontraform embedded) and I'm going to be looking at more of the deep sales funnel social media aspects which were released in recent months

initial_reviews.review_title: An incredible platform. The best I've used in 10+ years running my own businesses
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
Ontraport is the best small business software out there, bar none. Flexible. Easy to use. Intuitive. And SUPER powerful.

Since we've implemented Ontraport we have saved literally 0.8 of a staff member's time in admin and tasks (our previous platforms were SugarCRM). That's, like, $40,000 worth of saved time!!!

I LOVE the fact that it is effectively an all-in-one solution that will be enough for pretty much any small to medium sized business. However, its potential is basically limitless if you need to do deep integrations with other systems too...so even the stuff where our business works 'out of the box' we are able to easily connect Ontraport to other platforms for highly specialised work.

What else.....

Their Customer Support are phenomenal. The best out there. They are online, like 18 hours per day (maybe a little less on weekends) and you can call, chat or email in....and actually get  a real response, no matter how small the question. Their online Facebook community is like nothing I've ever seen too - responsive, supportive, funny...

Ontraport's dynamic CMS has allowed us to build all sorts of interesting web experiences for our clients, technology that you'd usually pay a lot more for but it's at everyone's fingertips. Love how this platform is constantly innovating and improving.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
The fact we can't do Postcards here in Australia is a bit of a pain, but that's related to an external integration (I'm guessing), so not really OPs fault.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
This product will change your business BUT you have to spend enough time working on it. Set aside a couple of hours to work ON (not IN) your account each week and you will reap the rewards.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have automated parts of our workflow that I didn't think were possible. We've integrated our marketing (e.g. Facebook ads) directly in with our client support (Ontraport's CRM features) so our business has become so much more streamlined. We've literally saved tens of thousands of dollars in staff time and have only been using it for about 9 months.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
It is easy to share and send emails between groups of people to get feedback and work together. Making our website part of Ontraport has made it possible to make easy changes and get quality information and data. A/B testing has proven to be very useful for our landing pages and emails. Our sales and marketing teams use Ontraport exclusively to create campaigns, send emails to potential customers and perform automated actions. It is helpful to have all of our files and documents in one place that is easy to access. We are also currently transitioning our website to Ontraport and have recently seen the benefits of being able to create landing pages with a fast design and perform contrast testing.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Real-time edits would be ideal. If there are multiple people working on the same thing, you will be fired and your changes will likely not be retained. The ability to modify announcements via the calendar is annoyingly complex. There is no proper way to edit or update a section simultaneously. You will have to visit each person separately. Ontraport incorporated some collaboration tools, however, I think this could be improved. I would like to see more alternatives for writing emails and ways to share changes, as well as approval paths.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
I find Ontraport marketing to be helpful for organizations that need a little guidance to get started. There are numerous predefined templates and alternatives to choose from. Also, there are excellent alternatives to testing that make it easy to spot what works and what doesn't. However, for those looking for more collaboration and tools to interact in real time, I'm not sure this is the way to go. We can more quickly perceive the effect that web and landing pages have on test requests. Although it's not simple to set up, there is a lot of data to collect to better understand which ads are working and which parts of our funnel need help. I like that everything is connected and easy to access from the same place. We have decreased the time lag between each customer visit, and increased the number of closed sales.

edited to add: i am fangirling their whole damn support team. they are dreamy.

Ontraport impresses me for two reasons.

First, OP is the first platform that has me believing that an all-in-one platform is a good choice. Over the past year I've looked at a number of CRMs, LMSs, and ESPs, and I didn't like any all-in-one options so I was prepared to stitch together different platforms to get the experience I'm after. But as I've explored OP during the trial period I can see its power for my future business - the business I'm building toward over the next year. I can totally see how putting these systems in place while the business is still smal will be very smart over the longer haul. I can see the way it will save me time. I can see the way I can more easily bring team-members on. It's very exciting.

Second, their customer service is TO DIE FOR. My first call didn't go super well and I shared that feedback -- in the post-support survey and also with the person who recommended OP to me. Next thing I knew the SWAT team had swooped in, and everybody was on deck to make sure I was taken care of. I get extra TLC from a VP, a long call with an account exec, and very attentive support in the chat. They understood my questions, kept me focused on the most crucial things I needed to know to launch my membership, and helped me see what was possible and how to do it with my very short deadline.

The people truly are extraordinary, and are 100% the reason I'm signing on as a new client.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
The price -- with a caveat.

I've been exploring membership sites and that's my primary use for OP right now. Given that, I wish it had a better entry price point, since I'm not looking for an all-in-one CRM/ESP/payment platform/course platform etc.

That said, for its full power, I think OP is well-priced. And much to my surprise, the trial period has me thinking about how well OP will serve my future business. So I'm willing to pay more now with the hope that it's the right move longer-term. But it *is* more than I would pay if I were just choosing a membership platform.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
I came to Ontraport to explore a membership platform. I really want a platform that has a community chat feature, which they don't all have. I also wanted a user-friendly design for my members. Other platforms I've looked at have had one but not both. Ontraport has them both. Add to that the simplicity of payment processing and integrations and I'm very happy with OP as a solution.

Even more, it is simple to set up email automations and reminders within the membership, and now that I can do that I can imagine using it as my ESP and my CRM moving forward. So they're solving a problem I wasn't looking to solve because I had another solution...but OP's solution looks better.

all_reviews.review_title: One Happy Customer!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
Ontraport is a highly flexible CRM and sales platform and the ease of implementation by way of the support teams onboarding skills was a massive part of my decision to choose this.  Sure it's possible to nickel and dime your way through all of the various facets with a selection of alternate products but this is pretty much a one stop shop for all marketing teams of most sizes.  It's pricey for small businesses but when your time is at a premium, for me it's a no brainer.

Ontraport offer a support team which in my experience is absolutely second to none.  The team are constantly working on feature enhancements and it's virtually unheard of to have senior management not only hanging out in a user group but actively responding to questions and queries.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
It's a really highly customisable platform but the down side is that it can be difficult to find the specific item you're looking for.  This has been offset somewhat by the huge Ontraport University funciton which has videos and guides for most things and also the top notch live chat and support team.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
I host a variety of online courses on Ontraport and also have an automated sales funnel at the front end of this.  It captures leads from my website (ontraform embedded) and I'm going to be looking at more of the deep sales funnel social media aspects which were released in recent months

all_reviews.review_title: An incredible platform. The best I've used in 10+ years running my own businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
Ontraport is the best small business software out there, bar none. Flexible. Easy to use. Intuitive. And SUPER powerful.

Since we've implemented Ontraport we have saved literally 0.8 of a staff member's time in admin and tasks (our previous platforms were SugarCRM). That's, like, $40,000 worth of saved time!!!

I LOVE the fact that it is effectively an all-in-one solution that will be enough for pretty much any small to medium sized business. However, its potential is basically limitless if you need to do deep integrations with other systems too...so even the stuff where our business works 'out of the box' we are able to easily connect Ontraport to other platforms for highly specialised work.

What else.....

Their Customer Support are phenomenal. The best out there. They are online, like 18 hours per day (maybe a little less on weekends) and you can call, chat or email in....and actually get  a real response, no matter how small the question. Their online Facebook community is like nothing I've ever seen too - responsive, supportive, funny...

Ontraport's dynamic CMS has allowed us to build all sorts of interesting web experiences for our clients, technology that you'd usually pay a lot more for but it's at everyone's fingertips. Love how this platform is constantly innovating and improving.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
The fact we can't do Postcards here in Australia is a bit of a pain, but that's related to an external integration (I'm guessing), so not really OPs fault.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
This product will change your business BUT you have to spend enough time working on it. Set aside a couple of hours to work ON (not IN) your account each week and you will reap the rewards.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have automated parts of our workflow that I didn't think were possible. We've integrated our marketing (e.g. Facebook ads) directly in with our client support (Ontraport's CRM features) so our business has become so much more streamlined. We've literally saved tens of thousands of dollars in staff time and have only been using it for about 9 months.

all_reviews.review_title: Honest Review From a 7-Year ONTRAPORT Account Holder
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
ONTRAPORT has one of the most user-friendly interfaces in the CRM space. I'd used many CRMs prior to opening my ONTRAPORT account, and none of them compare to the simplistic and sleek appeal of ONTRAPORT's interface. Also, ONTRAPORT has some of the most generous and upbeat support staff members that I've ever had the pleasure of engaging. There are very few "bad" experiences that I can recall with support. Overall, ONTRAPORT is one of the most solid platforms on the market. As someone who has been using it for seven years (and counting), I'm still very proud of the investment of time and money that I've made in this SaaS.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Every system has it's occasional glitches, so this is not something that can be escaped--no matter what tool you choose to use. That said, ONTRAPORT could do a better job of informing customers of how updates/changes to the platform will affect their account. For example, in the past I'd have new ONTRAPORT clients end their free trial and sign up for the paid account; however, after some changes, I learned the hard way that is no longer permitted. It would've been nice to know that before engaging the customer.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
ONTRAPORT provides a seamless and streamlined process that allows me and my clients to easily communicate with contacts without having to log into several different accounts.

all_reviews.review_title: Ontraport is the best choice in Marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
It is easy to share and send emails between groups of people to get feedback and work together. Making our website part of Ontraport has made it possible to make easy changes and get quality information and data. A/B testing has proven to be very useful for our landing pages and emails. Our sales and marketing teams use Ontraport exclusively to create campaigns, send emails to potential customers and perform automated actions. It is helpful to have all of our files and documents in one place that is easy to access. We are also currently transitioning our website to Ontraport and have recently seen the benefits of being able to create landing pages with a fast design and perform contrast testing.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Real-time edits would be ideal. If there are multiple people working on the same thing, you will be fired and your changes will likely not be retained. The ability to modify announcements via the calendar is annoyingly complex. There is no proper way to edit or update a section simultaneously. You will have to visit each person separately. Ontraport incorporated some collaboration tools, however, I think this could be improved. I would like to see more alternatives for writing emails and ways to share changes, as well as approval paths.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
I find Ontraport marketing to be helpful for organizations that need a little guidance to get started. There are numerous predefined templates and alternatives to choose from. Also, there are excellent alternatives to testing that make it easy to spot what works and what doesn't. However, for those looking for more collaboration and tools to interact in real time, I'm not sure this is the way to go. We can more quickly perceive the effect that web and landing pages have on test requests. Although it's not simple to set up, there is a lot of data to collect to better understand which ads are working and which parts of our funnel need help. I like that everything is connected and easy to access from the same place. We have decreased the time lag between each customer visit, and increased the number of closed sales.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
I love being able to manage my leads and clients on a personal level. With the flexibility Ontraport provides such as tagging, automations, rules, triggers, and if/and statements, they feel I am talking directly to them instead of just another name on my email list. Nothing is worse to me than when I buy someone's product and they keep emailing me like I am a prospect.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
There have been a few automations that I feel should be really simple to do, but the ability to do them just isn't there. This requires more manual touchpoints than I would like. However, at least there are some workarounds to get the job done... at the end of the day, that is the most important thing.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ontraport solves the problem of bringing a lead into my system, nurturing them, and then moving them into a conversion and treating them as a client once they get there. Automated flows make it easy for me to keep in touch and make sure balls are not dropped, and the ability to tag, group contacts, and send campaigns are all part of what helps me be a successful small business owner.

all_reviews.review_title: All My Back-Office Support under One Roof!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
Ontraport is an entrepreneurial unicorn - I'd been searching for years to find a service that could provide everything (contact management, autoresponders, landing pages, a membership site, forms, etc.) in one place.  Ontraport does that beautifully!

I'm a huge OntraPeeps fan.  Their customer service is outstanding - their Live Chat is convenient and efficient anytime I run into a challenge in structuring something, and their online resource guides are thorough.  If I need anything beyond that, they are always quick to escalate the issue for further research and action.

Ontraport is also easy to use.  Their drag-and-drop structure of building everything makes it accessible and understandable to "normal" folk as well as convenient for techies.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Honestly, the only frustrations I've had have been when I've needed a feature that didn't exist.  Many times, it was something that Ontraport was already working on.  I appreciate that their support staff is always willing to go the extra mile to help me find a workaround.  In addition, there's also an easy way to request new features - a forum where they actually read and respond to requests!

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a solopreneur, it's always been challenging to create, connect, and track all the moving pieces of online marketing, contact engagement, and event management.  Ontraport gives me the tools and support I need to do that effectively.  As a result, once I create my back-office systems, I can focus more on the work I love to do!  I'm now able to reach more people and foster those connections over time.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
I won't forget anything thanks to Ontraport! I love all of the automations that I can set up to remind me to complete a task, email a student, and give me a heads up on something. It's amazing how much time and brain space that Ontraport has cleared up for me. I also LOVE their support team! I never hesitate if I have a question or need help thinking through an automation, to reach out to support for guidance. They are all so helpful and patient. I typically interact with the same few people every time, too, which is a bonus!

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
There have been a couple of things we've had to work through since joining Ontraport about a year ago, just small, weird kinks, but nothing that has been repetitive. I do wish they would make it easier to switch account owners (that was a recent, confusing hiccup). We use Ontraport to host our course, and I do wish they would add something, so we can see our students' progress in the course. Ontraport told me before I signed up that they do not have this feature, but I felt that all of the pros far outweighed this one con. I will say, I was a bit overwhelmed when I first started using Ontraport, but after playing with it and creating a student profile for myself to view it as a customer, I became comfortable and even quick with creating pages and automation. It really is all worth it!

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
I no longer have to set reminders for myself each week to email our students. We have moved away from using MailChimp to email our students, which was a HUGE win! It has so much customization in it!!

The ease of use of the visual campaign editor is why my organization made the purchase in the first place. In addition, creating forms using the simple editor and creating landing pages using the drag-and-drop editor is a breeze. This makes it quick and simple to create landing pages and embed forms to track conversions. I like the clean interface; very easy to navigate. Managing contact records (aside from duplicates) is a breeze with the clean user interface. The Ontraport API  allowed us to greatly enhance the functionality and automation.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Lack of in-depth reporting functionality. A dashboard is available, but it lags behind similar competitors in this space. I found that the Tasks and task management settings aren't the greatest or easiest to use. Furthermore, my team and I opted not to use the Deals feature(s) for a similar reason. To track sales, we implemented our own custom updates using the Ontraport API. Managing duplicated contact records can be a challenge, as well. Finally, Ontraport seems to lack some of the features of enterprise CRM's and is desperately lacking in available integrations. Most anything you may want to integrate requires use of Zapier, which adds unnecessary complexity and cost.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we initially looked to solve using Ontraport is a dramatic lack of marketing engagement with our customers. We needed a way to market to and engage with our customers and track those interactions beneath the same roof. In addition, we relied entirely upon unsolicited, inbound sales to sell our product. With Ontraport, it enabled us to deploy a dedicated sales process and increase our conversions.

Like setting up our own ticketing system, our own events management system, surveys too, and even automate some admin parts of our business beyond sales force automation. Plus it integrates well with other tools so much so it has become central to us! When I sometimes test other solutions (new or updated), I always go back to Ontraport because it really can do it, plus a lot more.

all_reviews.review_title: It's a Toyota, not a Ferrari
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
It's a pretty lean tool that doesn't have too many features that my team won't end up using. We had very specific needs that we wanted a marketing automation tool to address. And while many of the more popular tools (Hubspot, Pardot etc.) did exactly what we wanted it to do, they also did too much and we couldn't justify the pricetag that came with them as well.

Ontraport is like a Toyota - affordable, reliable, well built, no feature overload. ie. Perfect for a small team that wouldn't have the time or expertise for a full on marketing automation tool.

Also, their Facebook group is really helpful because it gives you a direct line to the team and user community for support!

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
The email tracking for each individual user could be improved. Granted it's not purpose built for email marketing like Mailchimp, I still would like a way to easily look at all users in  a particular campaign and how they interact with each email sent to them. You can get the information, but it's not the most straightforward way.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
Have a clear understanding of how much (or little) your team needs. If you need something really robust that can do it all, Ontraport is not for you. However, if your needs are lean and manageable and you only have a small team who has the time and space to use the tool, it could be worth considering.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?

- Automate the routing of inbound leads to Salesforce
- Build landing pages that could be hosted on Wordpress
- Set up campaigns

all_reviews.review_title: How Work Gets Done
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
My favorite aspect of Ontraport is it's intuitive, easy to navigate interface as well as the clean, top-down campaign builder. With the campaign builder, it's easy to determine what comes next with color- and shape-coded elements, making it quick to build a campaign to reach one's target audience. The handy checklist that's provided let's me know if I missed anything before the campaign is published.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Ontraport offers a lot of features and functionality. When we first got started, it was our organization's first time with a combination CRM/marketing automation tool, especially one as powerful as Ontraport. Therefore, it was tough for us to determine where we ought to begin; what do we need to do; aside from the obvious, what's most useful for us. Ontraport does provide two, hour-long on-boarding calls. Sadly, they only scratch the surface.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a clear way to aggregate all our customer engagements in one easy-to-use platform; track tasks; collect notes, etc. In addition, we didn't perform any proactive marketing outreach at the time and needed a solution to jumpstart our email marketing strategy.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
I love everything about the Ontraport CRM platform ... the automation features, payment processing, landing pages & forms, ease of use, and most of all, everything you get for the super affordable price you pay. You really just can't beat it! I also love the third-party integrations & continued growth that I see in Ontraport ... the list goes on. So thank you for being great! I've had you for a few years now and have referred many people to you already. I look forward to being apart of your continued success & growth.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
I really can't think of any downsides. I guess if I had to pick something, then it would be features that I hope to see developed soon, like integrations with RingCentral, and perhaps a few more automated triggers that aren't there yet. None of this stops the flow of my business though. But once developed, they will certainly help with continued improvement of time efficiency for my business.

I recommend that you at least try it. Ontraport now offers a 30 day free trial so you can't lose. And even if you're not a techie person, Ontraport offers free screen-share sessions to walk you through everything you need to know and get you up and running. The competition won't do this for free. They won't even do it for close to free. So it really is a no-brainer. Just sign up and start growing and improving your business today!

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ontraport gives my team the tools and resources necessary to work in a unified manner, and save lots of time. Very few tasks do we complete manually. We don't have to "remember" to do certain things because we've programmed our system automatically tell us when important tasks need to be done. We're not even using half of the power that Ontraport holds and yet, it's still enough for us.

all_reviews.review_content:

I like that we were able to utilize Ontraport for Lead Management & Customer Success. I also like the Ontraport interface a lot because it makes it easier to use. We were pretty familiar with other CRMs like SalesForce and InfusionSoft before coming on board with Ontraport, and so the learning curve was not too sharp. Now we use Ontraport primary for Managing Leads, Campaigns for Leads, and Renewal Sales. We took about 6 months of all-day meetings to talk through Ontraport, and then make it work for our use case. Customer Support is a bit hit or miss. Now that it is working, we are super excited about all the possibilities.

all_reviews.review_title: Great All in One Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
Ontraport is a powerful all in one program perfect for small businesses that want to have email campaign functionality, website plug-ins (forms and pages), and contact management. As a small team, we like being able to have one program that fits all of these needs so that all contact data is collected and tracked in one place. The program itself has a lot of customization options so you can create fields for companies and contacts that are relevant to your business. The customer support is outstanding for this program - there are customer support specialists that are available to chat or screenshare, as well as account representatives and onboarding specialists. If those people are unavailable, they also have many how-to forms and videos to help with FAQs.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
As with many CRMs, especially all-in-one programs like this, it takes some time to learn the logic. To get yourself off to a good start, I'd recommend making the most of the onboarding calls by going in with a specific objective for the account set-up.

Secondly, there is also a lot of manual input required for simple tasks like adding a contact. There are programs out there that data scrape for email, social media sites, and more to make contact data import more efficient. This program does not have that feature which makes contact input more time-consuming. Additionally, it does not have a gmail plug-in so contacts have to be added independently.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking for an all-in-one CRM/email marketing program so that we could have detailed data on our contacts in one place. As a small business with a large customer/client network, we are enjoying the customizability of the program that improves our workflow and expands our options on what's possible.

all_reviews.review_title: Email templates are terrible, tons of bugs, do not recommend
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
We were initially drawn in by the long list of features, including incredible customization and automation features. However, it hasn't really delivered any of the functionality we were hoping for.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Just about everything. Customer support was great up until we actually purchased the software; now they seem relatively unwilling or unavailable to answer questions or solve problems. It's very customizable, but setting up one campaign with sequences to do everything you want it to do could take you all day. You might need a dedicated person whose only job is to setup and manage this system. As an employee of a small business, I simply didn't have the time to sit and work with it all day. It has a very high learning curve; none of the features were intuitive, and it seemed like the support staff had limited knowledge of how it works. I watched all of the tutorial videos and came away feeling like there was still a lot of knowledge missing. The email templates are buggy, clunky, and much too rigid for our needs, and this is the case for all of their templates. OntraForms and OntraPages gave us similar experiences. Their API was terrible and did not play well with our website, and therefore most of the tracking and eCommerce features were unavailable to us. We had repeated issues with uploading contact lists. If you can't take advantage of all the options, it's very expensive in comparison to other, more user-friendly alternatives.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
You only get two hours of dedicated support with their staff. Make sure you try out the software well in advance before you schedule this meeting, because you will likely have a lot of questions. The person we got matched with for our meeting did not have an answer to most of our questions, so I think it would be helpful to have prepared them in advance and submitted them prior to the meeting so that we could've been matched with a more knowledgeable support team member. I would also recommend watching any tutorial videos you can find to see if this is something you are prepared to learn how to use, because it will take time to learn about all of the features.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
None. We switched back to using MailChimp and a free CRM and have been so much happier.

all_reviews.review_title: Becoming a World-Class Marketing Automation Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
Ontraport's new campaign builder is amazing.  It's the most powerful, intuitive, and beautiful campaign builder I've ever used.  It was a long time coming, but they got it right on day one.  An an all-in-one platform, their marketing automation functionality works seamlessly with the CRM.  Ontraport's marketing automation is best-in-class, which is a great accomplishment for a platform most have never heard of.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
The CRM itself is weak and clunky out-of-the box.  By default, contact records are flat, meaning there is no native functionality for one-to-many relationships such as accounts/companies hierarchy without custom configuration.  While such configuration is possible, it isn't intuitive and natural to use this add-on functionality for entities. Similarly, there is no native functionality to track "Opportunities" without creating this yourself.  As such the CRM functions more like a flat database of contact fields.  We began using Ontraport before they added entity relationships, so perhaps if we had signed on with such abilities at first, this would have worked itself out.

Emails don't support dynamic, conditional content.  Sure, you can merge field values in, but you can't show/hide content blocks based on field values.  This limitation holds back email marketing effectiveness by forcing email campaign messaging to be hard-coded.

There are a lot of out-of-the-box reports, but it's not easy to deeply query the data to do business reporting natively.  We end up exporting to Excel to put the data into Tableau, which is a very tedious reporting workflow -- which would be even more tedious if we *were* using their one-to-many relationships.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ontraport is currently being used by our sales and marketing teams to track and communicate with our leads.  Yet because of the difficulties described above, we are about to move to another vendor.

all_reviews.review_title: The definition of simplicity.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
With their most recent update, Ontraport has literally knocked it out of the park.

One of the biggest and most important improvements (in my opinion) is the simplicity of the tracking that is built in to the new visual campaign builder.  I used to dread trying to interpret all the tracking information that is available to us... I actually don't think I ever had our tracking software fully set up because figuring out all the steps/goals/etc was clunky and confusing to me.  With OP5, I don't think I will ever have a need for any other tracking software... it is all there in an easy to digest layout, and with all the different tracking reports, it has enabled us to see exactly where we were doing well and where we need some work.  Having this all in one system and having it automatically track and intuitively report every step that is taken through our campaigns in real time without any additional setup has been a game changer for us.

Another thing I love is how engaged the upper level management is directly with their customer base and its wants/needs.  I don't know how many CEO's get into the trenches with their customers, but Landon is frequently answering questions, offering tips and training, and even soliciting feedback within the Ontraport user community so they can continually improve Ontraport, in turn helping their customers improve their businesses.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
I wish that Ontraport had the option to track inventory of a product.

I used to have a longer list, but with their most recent update, they solved them all.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
Their most recent update (OP5) is mind blowing in my opinion.  It solved some of the biggest problems I had with prior versions of Ontraport, specifically simplifying the setup of campaigns and having really easy to understand metrics on every single step that a customer takes through our campaigns.   They are constantly listening to their users and looking for ways to improve the product.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ontraport has given us the ability to have a top down view of our entire business, without the need for tons of add-ons or integrations.  They have somehow struck the perfect balance between simplicity and flexibility, which are usually at odds with eachother.  We can't even imagine doing business without Ontraport anymore.

We have been able to drastically simplify the back end processes of our business which has reduced our labor costs and freed up resources to be put toward new projects that would otherwise still be on the back burner.

all_reviews.review_title: Customizable... but at what cost?
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
Ontraport's greatest strength is its ability to be customized. You can set up a lot of fields and rules and sequences to create highly customized workflows... if you really know what you're doing. At my previous employer, when we used this tool, only one person had the know-how to make Ontraport really valuable for us. And for her, managing Ontraport was almost a fulltime job. However, for companies on a limited budget, you can create some functionalities that other economic options probably couldn't give you.

It also integrates with Zapier, which gives non-superusers the ability to still add some good functionalities with tools like GotoWebinar, Clearbit, Facebook Lead Ads, etc.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
In my experience, Ontraport is very difficult to use. The interface is not intuitive, and the logic can get very convoluted. Since there's no version or activity tracking, there's no way to quickly fix a mistake or see who updated a contact or email and when. The tool is also pretty buggy, with random outages and failures routinely delaying us.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
When doing a cost/benefit analysis, be sure to factor in time and training. all_reviews.review_title: Great salesfunnel automation options but restrictive templates
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
When creating a sequence of automated emails (especially in regards to a sales funnel or a client retention funnel)--Ontraport offers an incredible level of automation. You can send an email out to a prospect, and depending on their actions, set up a variety of corresponding emails to follow. Did they click a certain link that shows they have interest in one of your products? Why not create an automated follow up that offers a promotion for said object. Etc. etc.

The other thing I like is that Ontraport really covers everything you need in terms of a basic marketing/sales CRM. It has automated emails, customer management, pop-ups for your site, and based on your preferences, can even let you send out physical mailers without ever having to actually touch a stamp yourself.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
I dislike that with every email you send, they include an address at the top in the "from" section that denotes you have sent it through their system. We have our own custom domain email headings, and people could easily be confused as to why their emails include a second party company they may never have heard of. From there, they might suspect we are sharing our info with other companies, and no one wants that.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
Yes, but know their email templates are extremely restrictive and limited. They definitely need more options.

Support seems responsive but it really does not make sense when features are not good;

3- System can be very slow and not responding at times.

6- Ecommerce payment part is very basic.  you can not run a simple shopping cart.
7- No visual Campaign automation editor. you can not create a logical work flow.  You have to do it on paper manually and keep good offline records because everything is everywhere.  bad layout.

Recommendations to others considering Ontraport:
do not use it.  we switched to agilecrm and we are really happy with it.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have not realized any benefits, wasted a lot of time and money instead.

all_reviews.review_title: Updated Review:: Ontraport is a LOT for not much support.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Ontraport?
When I decided to dramatically uplevel my consulting business - The Yogipreneur - I knew my business model was shifting from 1 to 1 services to online training programs. As I started to build out my suite of training programs, I quickly realized that I needed 5 different solutions {membership software, video hosting, automated email marketing, affiliate management, and shopping cart}  to handle what Ontraport offered in ONE. I love that all my programs can exist under one roof - especially since many of my clients end up purchasing several different program - and they can log into my membership site ONCE to access them all. Since moving to Ontraport, I've easily seen 3X growth in my business in the past 2 years {with my revenues moving from 80% 1 on 1 consulting to 80% online training programs}.

Update August 2014 - At this time, after experiencing little to no support from Ontraport as my business continued to grow, I have moved to Simplero.com - a similar all-in-one platform with incredibly 1x1 support and personalized service.

What do you dislike about Ontraport?
Ontraport has features upon features and I'm slowly learning them all! I really didn't have the time to master the software before using it... and that's been the greatest weakness. I'm thrilled to know that Ontraport is now certifying people to use it - I'm excited that my team will be able to become experts and it will be easier to hire people for specific projects.

Update August 2014 - After spending over 2 years {that's over $7200} on Ontraport and never utilizing all the features, PLUS needing to hire developers to run my membership site, I've dramatically reduced my ongoing expenses with Simplero.com. It got to the point where I was looking at spending another $1,000 per month on a team member just to manage Ontraport.

The real straw that broke the camels back was the diminishing level of support. It seemed that as Ontraport grew, the "personal super hero" I was supposed to have on call dissapeared and I was left to figure a LOT out on my own.

What problems is Ontraport solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Ontraport, I replaced 5 different systems that were clunky and held together with duct tape. Seriously - when you're building a business that depends on online programs being delivered, there is nothing worse than dealing with lots of support questions because access to a program wasn't delivered when they checked out... or realizing that a payment was missed and having to manually follow-up. Ontraport makes all the systems work together seamlessly + dramatically simplifies all the processes you need to run your biz!

Update August 2014 - Yes, Ontraport does many many things... but I was not able to utilize many of them without needing additional support, which I couldn't get from Ontraport without paying their conceirge team {which always had a wait list} or hiring a consultant. So much happier with the support I'm receiving at Simplero.com

I would say only go after Ontraport if you're really planning to utilize the if-then tagging capabilities and do much more advanced marketing.
